theorem.caption: Column space and image of linear map

statement.para: Let the (m,n)-matrix \Mtrx{A} represent the linear map L\from \RNr[n]\to \RNr[m]. Then \Vect{y}\in \RNr[m] belongs to the image of L if and only if it belongs to the column space of \Mtrx{A}.

proof.para: We begin by recalling the definitions

li.para: The image of L consists of all those \Vect{y} in \RNr[m] for which the equation L(\Vect{x} ) = \Vect{y} has a solution.
We know that, for each \Vect{x} in \RNr[n], L(\Vect{x}) = A\cdot \Vect{x}.

Thus the image of L consists of all those \Vect{y} \in \RNr[m] for which the matrix equation \Mtrx{A}\Vect{x} = \Vect{y} has a solution. Now, we
